title: specified formatting not applied if `format_args()` is passed to `println!()`

labels.name: T-libs
labels.description: Relevant to the library team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
use std::fmt;

struct A {}

impl fmt::Debug for A {
    fn fmt(&self, f: &mut fmt::Formatter<'_>) -> fmt::Result {
        write!(f, "1234567890")
    }
}

pub fn main() {
    println!("{:<.5}", "1234567890");
    let a = A {};
    println!("{:<.5}", format_args!("{:?}", a));
}

```
[playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=903a18ebbfabe8cf0255e786e5630ae7)

I expected to see this happen:
I would expect both lines `print`s to print the same output.

Instead, this happened: 
output is
````
12345
1234567890
````
and there is no warning that the second `println!` completely ignores the formatting directives `:<.5` that I passed.
